page.title: 05HOUSING IN BISHOP MIDDLEHAM
page.content: Of the area covered in the survey block,the village of Bishop Middleham accounts for most of the housing; the rest being predominantly scattered farmhouses. There are few large old stone buildings in the village. Of these The Hall, Hall Farmhouse, The Old Vicarage and the Manor House remain. The oldest streets in the village are mainly terraced. Later developments also favour terraced two storey buildings and bungalows. Two estates have been completed fairly recently and these incorporate a variety of house styles including detached,semi-detached,terraced and bungalows.
